skill.name: pdf
skill.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/splitting documents, and handling forms. When Claude needs to fill in a PDF form or programmatically process, generate, or analyze PDF documents at scale.
skill.summary: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/sp...
skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: Legitimate PDF manipulation toolkit. Contains documentation and Python scripts using standard PDF libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab) for document operations. No malicious patterns, network calls, or credential access detected. Filesystem access is expected for a document processing tool.

content.value_statement: Need to extract data from PDFs, fill forms, or merge documents? Claude can read, create, and modify PDFs using Python libraries and command-line tools.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDF documents
Fill interactive PDF forms with data
Merge multiple PDFs into one document
Convert PDF pages to PNG images
limitations: Cannot process image-only PDFs without OCR (scanned documents)
Complex form layouts may need manual verification

use_cases.title: Extract data from papers
use_cases.description: Pull tables and text from research papers for analysis or reference

use_cases.title: Fill PDF forms automatically
use_cases.description: Complete forms by providing field values through JSON configuration

use_cases.title: Process contract documents
use_cases.description: Split multi-page contracts, extract clauses, merge redlined versions

prompt_templates.title: Basic extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Read the PDF at [file.pdf] and tell me how many pages it has, then extract all the text

prompt_templates.title: Table extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all tables from [report.pdf] and save them to a CSV file

prompt_templates.title: Form filling
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill out the form in [application.pdf] using these field values: name=John Smith, email=john@example.com, date=2025-01-06

prompt_templates.title: Document assembly
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge all PDFs in the [input] folder into one file, then split it into separate files by chapter

output_examples.input: Read document.pdf and tell me what it contains

best_practices: Use pdfplumber for text extraction, pypdf for document manipulation, and qpdf for command-line operations
Extract tables with coordinates when precision matters for downstream processing
Split large PDFs before processing to avoid memory issues
anti_patterns: Do not copy-paste text manually when programmatic extraction is faster
Do not confuse fillable form fields with visual text boxes (they require different approaches)
Do not attempt to edit PDFs designed for printing (use print-to-PDF workflow instead)

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires Python environment with pypdf and pdfplumber installed.

faq.question: What Python packages do I need?
faq.answer: Install pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab, and pdf2image via pip. Some CLI tools require poppler-utils.

faq.question: How do I fill fillable PDF forms?
faq.answer: Run extract_form_field_info.py to list fields, create field_values.json with data, then run fill_fillable_fields.py.

faq.question: Is my data safe when processing PDFs?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is text extraction blank for my PDF?
faq.answer: Your PDF may be a scanned image. Use pytesseract with pdf2image for OCR, or convert to images first.

faq.question: How is this different from other PDF tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides Claude with structured workflows including validation, coordinate mapping, and form handling.
